Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2009 11:56AM toyful wrote: I was diagnosed stage 4 in 1/08 with mets to my chest wall. On December 4,2008 I noticed a small hard bump on my trachea. It definitely feels different than a swollen lymph node. Over the last 5 weeks it has grown fast and is now very visible, about the circumference of a quarter. Also, my breathing has become labored from just going up 1 flight of stairs. I am getting a petscan and catscan on January 13. I am quite confident that this is mets to the trachea. Please post what you found out from your pet scan.
Posts.Title: enlarged nodes in neck anitach toyful

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2009 01:43PM toyful wrote: It is so encouraging to read this thread with such a fantastic conclusion! It really gives me hope as I go to the doctor in 1 hour to find out the results of my scans yesterday! Michelle
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2009 10:32PM toyful wrote: Tamantha, I also got my scan results today. I am close to your age too and do not want to die.(45) My scans show new metastatic nodes in the ap window and lungs. My lungs have a large amount of fluid in them that is new and fluid around my heart. I was on Xeloda until today and now they are going to switch me to Navelbine. I have just got home and have not researched Navelbine yet, but my doctor says it has low side effects. I also have been on many hormonal and chemo therapies, which either don't work at all or only for a short time. I am also triple negative. Anyway, we have so much in common, maybe we can compare notes with our new phase of treatment!
Posts.Title: Scan results not good Tamantha suecco

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2009 03:29PM toyful wrote: ddlatt--i absolutely loved the kytril! It made a huge difference over all those other weaker drugs! I had absolutely no nausea on it.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo January 2009? lisalisa ktym

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2009 01:03PM toyful wrote: I was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer in 1/08 but was not able to start chemo until 3/08. While I was waiting, I drank Essiac tea. I was experiencing a lot of pain while I waited for chemo to begin, and the tea seemed to help a little bit with the pain. In 3/08, I started seeing a naturopath in addition to my oncologist, and the naturopath adamantly advised me to not take the tea. He said it would interfere with my chemo treatment. I stopped taking it at that time. Just to make this more confusing, I have been on 2 different chemo treatments and neither seems to be working much.
